alert.note: Alert for Mono (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued March 21 at 1:57PM PDT until March 22 at 5:00AM PDT by NWS Reno
info.description: ...WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM PDT WEDNESDAY... * WHAT...Heavy snow expected. Additional snow accumulations of 1 to 4 inches for communities generally north of Bridgeport, 4 to 10 inches for communities generally south of Conway Summit, and 1 to 2 feet along the crest. Wind gusts up to 70 mph along ridgelines. * WHERE...Mono County. * WHEN...Until 5 AM PDT Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. The hazardous conditions could impact the morning or evening commute. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Heaviest snowfall is expected early through the early afternoon with snowfall rates between 1 to 2 inches per hour likely. Thunder is possible (15% chance) through the afternoon.
info.instruction: Avoid travel if possible, you could be stuck in your vehicle for many hours. If you must travel, prepare for long delays and carry an emergency kit with extra food, water and clothing. If you stay home, have a backup plan in case of power outages. The latest road conditions can be obtained by calling 5 1 1.
